column3: Comfortable Central Accommodation...staffed with helpful, kind & friendly people
column4: Maybe the hotel is 3-star but the 5-star rating from me is for Mohammed from breakfast as I promised! Also a big Thank-You & 5* to Ahmed my big man at reception and ichrak & karima who turned over cleaned my room. The bed was extremely comfortable. It's central, I stayed at this Ibis hotel for 1 week.

column3: Typical Ibis hotel in walking distance from station.
column4: Walking distance from the station but a short taxi ride to other attractions. Perfectly fine - clean room - professional staff - breakfast a bit lacklustre. In short - a pretty typical Ibis hotel. I should add that we struggled to identify a good value hotel (with character) when planning our trip to Tangier so went with the safe Ibis option. It ticked the necessary boxes for us.

column3: Convenient for rail station - otherwise very unremarkable. Staff training needed.
column4: The room was OK. A bit less than most Ibis hotels, no soap at all, no bottled water, bedside table slightly broken. Bed comfortable. Great asset is that hotel is very close to rail station - just across the square. Staff are borderline unfriendly (great contrast with most Ibis where staff are jolly and welcoming). They were so sour that I did not take up the free drink but went across square to the Royal Tulip to have drink and dinner, They were Very professional. I did ask if they had a local map and was told to photo one on the wall!!! But I got one from the Royal Tulip Hotel next door.

column3: Hard to find much good, I’m afraid
column4: We decided to take the high speed train from Casablanca to Tangier with the intention of visiting Chefchaouen. We arrived at around 2:00 pm, checked in and spent the remainder of this first day seeing Tangier. It’s a lovely city! Then we woke up early the next day to meet our transfer to the Blue City. We returned to the Ibis and spent a second night. Basically, we were only there to sleep. This hotel was very small and bare boned. There were only two threadbare towels in our room and when we asked at 9 PM to get another towel, we were advised that housekeeping had gone home. We like to sleep with the window open and did so, but there is no screen on the huge window. (Very dangerous!). Did anyone know that mosquitoes can fly seven floors up? Lol. The bed had a 3-inch…

column3: Lots of value for the money !
column4: Great location, value for the money ! These Ibis hotels are located near so many central train stations, making it easier to get to and let’s you avoid the hassle of taking a taxi. The rooms are not luxury, but they are also very well priced, especially if you are travelling on vacation. Very friendly staff, huge meal servings (again at very low prices) and overall an excellent choice !

The good: -Hotel has a free underground parking (need to ask this at reception) -Friendly staff -Clean bed and room -Great location -Price The bad: -Horrible filthy pool (they don't even bother cleaning the pool area as its filled with bricks, sand, dirt and leafs inside and around the pool, nothing like in the photo) -Infrastructure is decaying and needs renovation (shower door didn't close well, light switches are loose,...) -Parking guys at the entrance of the hotel, why is this even allowed? And why is the reception not saying there is a free underground parking ? Overal a 6/10, mainly due to the price and location.

Stayed here twice, one night before catching the train to Casablanca, then two nights when I returned a week later after my trip. I have absolutely no complaints. Staff was wonderful, the room was an Ibis room, simple and clean and with a good bed and good shower. Location is fantastic for taking trains, walking along the shore into town, shopping at the mall, and breakfast was fantastic (if you complain about the selection I really would like to come to your house for breakfast because it must be spectaculair). I would choose to stay here in a heartbeat.

The bed sheet had a stain on it; the shower had mould on the ceiling, the edge of the table in the room was chipped. Photographs are available. Dinner was OK for 2 nights. On the third night the medium steak was like leather because '..that's how Moroccan people like it.' The steak was quickly replaced by a much better one.

I had an awful experience in this hotel. dirty and badly maintained. staff is not helpful. they sent the security guard to my room asking for the payment to be settled - never seen such thing and manners in any other hotels around the globe. I have been a long-time loyal customer of Ibis but due to this bad experience in this particular hotel I will never stay again with them in any part of the planet. Sad to see this hotel service declining.

It was just OK in all fairness, pretty much what you expect from Ibis! The room was basic and could have been a bit cleaner but it was decent. The location for us was ideal as we just had a day in Tangier before getting the train so it was close and was good for the mall too and some western comforts. The room could have been cleaner and it would be nice to have a safe. Plug sockets were in awkward locations too which was annoying. An alarm went off at 6 am and the phone in the room wasn't connected so we had to go down to see what was going on!

Had great stay , our room was always amazing clean with That little by Loubna the lady who cleaned our room everyday was amazing always a laugh and a smile. Very nice to start your day like that. In general nice

Other than the cheap price and decent breakfast, this hotel is really bad. Rooms, elevators, and everything in the rooms are not cleaned, floors are sticky meaning that you can’t walk barefoot or with socks on, the view and the bed sucks, and none of the basic items were found in the room (no hand soap, no slippers, no safe, nothing). I DO NOT recommend this hotel at all! Really bad

One of the worst hotels that I stayed in. Dirty full of cockroaches. Old furnitures. We changed the hotel at 9 pm bkz we can’t sleep there. The staff isn’t helpful.not experienced. The first room was small and building under construction view the second was looking to the mall but also dirty and full of cockroaches. The guy in the reception said that he can’t do any thing.

First tried calling the hotel multiple times no answer. Once I reached there I understood why the reception isn’t picking up the phone. One receptionist for lot of people. Hotel needs refurbishment a little bit. I am neutral in recommending this hotel.

The hotel was very nice and in a great location. The room was also nice and clean. The A/C wasn't working. I brought it to the staff, but it still wasn't fixed during our three day stay. Depite being close to a main road, the hotel wasn't loud.

Went here on business. Generally it is OK but nothing out of the ordinary. As is also typical of an IBIS, the staff are generally unhelpful (it must be part of their training to be miserable and unhelpful). Rooms are "ok" but in need of some maintenance as they are looking a little tired. There is some building work in the area but thankfully the double glazing deadened the noise. Think i would try an alternative over this place as the hotels are as cheap as chips in Tangier

Thanks a lot to personnel of the Hotel all our problems were sorted out in a most pleasant way. Thanks go to M K and Issam! OK for this business trip hotel. Very good place, has a bar and pool. Not so much to talk about, all is in order.

This hotel has stupid policy by not letting my male friend who live in Tangier to come inside my room to help me pack my things and some other stuff. They only allow guests to talk in the lobby and common room, while I want to talk and manage some stuff simultaneously in the room.

I had a very nice stay, I got the timevto visit Tangier with the help of the staff who were incredibly friendly and so satisfying, thank you very much for your kindness , I recommend this one , thank you

It was a great stay in ibis Tangier I was already there many times and its always a pleasure to come back. Thanks to receptionnist (MK) for making my stay comfortable and thank for being helpful and so much kind with me Thanks agaaain for little thing.

I visited ibis city center in August. I really appreciated the quality of the service . The staff was very friendly and kind . I won't miss the opportunity to come back very soon. I thank all the staff for their welcome

A great sense of hospitality! Great staff ! Friendly environment. Loved the breakfast buffet. The best thing was the view I got from my room. I must give 10 out of 10 on cleanliness! Great job guys. Love ❤

I stayed for two nights for a business meeting in town. Very happy to find that the rooms are well maintained and very clean and the hotel is quite modern. Great breakfast!! Very friendly front desk staff.

I spent a lovely weekend at this wonderful small paradis well organized with amazing staff very helpful and professional, I got a very nice room ; clean and well equipped ! I will definitely come back as I found this hotel the sum of all my needs ! Thank you ibis tanger .

Booked a night's stay after a day trip to Chefchauen, primarily due it's proximity to the railway station and central location. While, expectation was a no frills but comfortable stay synonymous with the Ibis name,mosquitoes in the room and air conditioning which just did not cool efficiently even when we turned it down to the minimum temperature, was not just unexpected but shocking for an internationally known brand.

My husband needed to see a doctor in Tanger. When we finished the visit, we were told we would need to stay 2 extra nights for the surgery and prep for the surgery. The front desk was very helpful in getting us our extra days. They were fabulous at check in and out. We had breakfast 2 of our 3 mornings. We both felt it is the best breakfast of all of the Ibis chain. Thank you for making this stay the best!

This is the worst Intl Branded hotel I have ever stayed in. The Front Desk is rude, lazy and incompetent, and the quality of the food and beverage is terrible. The staff spend a lot of time talking to each other, this includes when they are serving you. The physical hotel itself is fine for a select service hotel, clean and reasonably maintained (except one of the lifts was out of service 4 times during our 10 day stay). The room setup is so cheap, only a soap and a shampoo, nothing else. No glasses, cups, kettle, fridge, tea & coffee, pen & notepad, bottled water, nothing. And the towels and sheets have been used for so long they have gone a light grey colour and were thread bare. The housekeeping staff do work very hard and are happy to assist your requests. The location of…

I stayed there for 2 nights last weekend. The air-conditioner was so bad. To keep the room cool, I had no alternative but to put my Priority Pass membership card in the power slot when I went out. When I returned, the card was gone. I asked the front desk to check for me who made up my room that particular day and it must be her who took away my card. They were unable to identify who cleaned my room before I checked out on Monday morning. I have heard nothing from the hotel up until now. The shower of the room was also hopeless.

The room was not cleaned properly, dust on the closet, and bed sheets was not changed as there were some stains and they kept it for the entier stay, the AC was hot, elevator for first floor is not working just you have to wait for one only. Good things about the hotel is staff is amazing, location is wonderful near to the station and beach area.

within a walking distance from the main station, and commercial area but check in and check out process take a long time, In a early morning, nobody attended at frontdesk and a security staff tried to help me to check out. the room is clean and organised, simple and modern furnitures,for comfortable stay.

column3: Decent hotel in a good location
column4: The hotel is well located near the beach and in a new area of town with lots of hotels and restaurants; very near to the train station. The staff was friendly and reasonably efficient. The room was typical ibis...clean and a decent size. The only problem being one of the beds which had a few wooden slats missing/broken and this wasn't fixed even after reporting it. Breakfast was pretty good. There is a small pool which was quite busy but a bonus for an ibis. There were plenty of places to eat within an easy walk.

I Had a blast again in this hotel. I’m not changing my previous review. A wonderful Hotel, great staff, great food. Rooms always clean. And I love the location. My registration went very fast. Clean and spacious room. The bed was great. Special thumbs up to the director who’s always inquiring and looking to help.

Located beside the ONCF train station. Room was very small and hard bed. No views from windows and bare basics. Spend only minimum time here. Walking distance to beach and about 35 minutes walk to Medina. Take petite taxis and meter on is about 18 dirhams to Medina. Hotel was clean and served its purpose. One night.

The hotel exceeded our expectations. They had a really good service, a bar, a restaurant, pool, and other good amenities. The beds are really comfortable and the room has a good size. The bathroom is not so big, but sufficient.

column3: Amazing service, quality rooms, great Iftar wonderful"
column4: My husband and I recently stayed for 6 nights at the Ibis center ville Tanger. What a wonderful experience we had there. We had the best care and attention you could ask for. The evening meals were always delicious, just what we needed after a day of fasting during this holy month of Ramadan. The room was spacious and very clean. Thank you for making our stay memorable. I will definitely come back. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to enjoy Tangier.

Just a short stay in Tánger for one day... Ibis is a good choice with a convenient location with good services and friendly staff, especially Ibrahim at the Reception (who had offered a great help for my trip)... thanks again 🙏

column3: IBIS quality hotel in center of Tangers
column4: Good hotel with usual worldwide IBIS quality. Would recommend as a central hotel in Tangier for business. Friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant open extended hours even during Ramadan to cater for everybody. Brahim at reception knows what he is doing.

I arrived early, the front office staff were really friendly and helpful, Nabil checked me in so smoothly and made me feel it’s home. I had some enquiries and he clarified them all to me, he also helped me exchange currency. I highly recommend to any business/ leisure visitors.

5 star hotel with good staff and an excellent board of directors ho managed their power to give the visitors an excellent vacation from the restaurant to the rooms ho they are managed and cleand so perfectly.

It was amazing experience.The staff was Professional they pay attention to the small detail. the breakfast is very rich and diversify. the room was clean and the housekeeper is a reak sweatheart because she touched my heart during my stay! which i appreciat.

We felt so welcome , my family and myself such a great and memorable experience , special thanks to all the hotel stamp for their listening problems handling and the warm welcome , very high and delightful service

I was here for business and they told me to go there, first experience in ibis City center of Tangier, and I wasn’t disappointed! The service and the quality of the people and restauration made me feel much better. Kind of psychological place ! Because my job is stressful and I enjoyed, to stay here, Peace, silence, and good environment. Recommend this Hotel if u are here for business or any kind of activity!

I didn't stay here but upon arriving in tangier and having a 7 hour wait before my train. I looked for a place to leave my luggage while I could explore the city. The staff at the Ibis gladly helped and stored my luggage for free. Lovely staff!

We were stuck in Tangier due to inclement weather, and luckily we booked a night in this lovely budget hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the food of good standard and the service very efficient and friendly. Mohamed at the front desk stood out as providing excellent service - an authentic smile along with outstanding service.

Every thing was fine. No complains. Breakfast was very good. Everything was there. Alae managed breakfast well. Room was clean. Bathroom was clean. One fridge could be there. All the systems were good.

Vert Nice location clean Nice breakfast à lot of choice and the staff are very helpful 'ice and professional. Close to everything. There is à mall Just near by the beach at walking distance. There is Nice cozy swiming pool and terrace also close to public transport and taxis.

The location is very good. It is just a few minutes' walk from the train station. The lobby is also quite pleasant looking and in line with when I have stayed at Hotel Ibis in various European cities. However, the rooms bear no resemblance to the European Hotel Ibis rooms, which are quite nice. The room was very rundown and the bed was rock hard. Also, don't believe them when they say that they have air conditioning. It doesn't work at all. And you can't open the windows to compensate as there are no screens on them and it is loud outside.

column3: Pleasant stay at a good location
column4: Next to the railway station, little fun park, little shopping center, walkable distance to the beach...Nice, very helpful and professional staff but they had some helpers? that weren't able to speak with us (in English) and were always pointing at the other receptionists.

We had a great stay at Ibis Tangier. All the staff were very helpful and polite- especially the Manager. Accommodation is clean and modern. 5-stars for service! Would definitely stay again and recommend to all!

column3: I can honestly recommend this hotel
column4: My opinion Very friendly place,near center😉 & friendly staff speaking English. I tried the delicious dish for dinner wonderful fresh tajine🍲 applauding for the chef👏👏👏 A well-kept and clean room I am a satisfied guest,

column3: Good for some days in Tanger.
column4: Good having in mind quality to price. Good staff. Good localisation, near of train station, beach and restantants. When I come back to Tanger in sure that I will stay again in this hotel. I save a good impression of all people that belongs to this hotel.

Even though our previous experience was dire, we thought we will try again. We asked for a nice room as per poor experience last time. We didn’t sleep till 5am because of sewage and burning smell. It was vile. We went for breakfast, no staff to be seen in the restaurant at 8.15 am but guests having their breakfast. We went to reception to ask if anybody was working in the restaurant. Eventually this woman came out to make Moroccan bread and looked at us as if she was doing us a favour. Waste of money ! As a silver card holder of Accorhotels we got no previledges. Reception manager not bothered and general manager non existent. I wouldn’t stay here again even if it was free. DISGUSTING !

This place although not Uber expensive should have a certain standard. On the whole I found the place poorly maintained, in average to poor condition and generally looking very sad and decrepit. Although the cleaning staff and breakfast staff were attentive and friendly it’s very hard to feel the ibis name can be justified due to the generally very average condition of rooms . Towels and linen were very old and worn and in general I wouldn’t return to this plac e

You get what you have paid for with this hotel..... It is clean and in a good location. The rooms are OK but basic and not for lovers of white fluffy towels. We ate out as there are lots of food options outside the hotel. There is a shopping mall close by with a good supermarket and food court. The train station is very close by - 5 mins walking so great for our early train to Fes. We asked for an extra pillow three times at reception over our two day stay but it never arrived.... We would stay there again.

Been several times in different IBIS hotels worldwide. This was a first - experienced a very uncomfortable situation, showing the lack of tact, discretion and professionalism of the desk clerk. Went with 3 female friends who checked-in prior to my arrival. While returning with one of my female friends who had checked-in earlier in her own room, I was asked /doube-checked about her name, her room number etc. I find it appauling that they dont know which guests are checked in, and when not knowing, - ask other guests for their information! Bottom line - Poor experience.

One of the best Ibis i have stayed in. Great location just a few minutes from beach. Very clean and well kept. Friendly staff. Excellent rooms, fantastic wifi all for a great price. Highly recommended

This hotel was booked for me, for one night. It is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Lunch and diner are good but not much choice and the breakfast was a nice buffet. The room was small and not very modern ...

I had a 3 nights /4 days stay in this Hotel, it's near the Mall, the beach and the Train Station. loved the stay there and if someone is visiting Tangier with limited budget, you can book there The staff are helpful and Friendly.

Well placed but my bedroom was dirty, the floor of the bedroom, the small table next to the bed and the bathroom. It was not well cleaned. Breakfast room was also dirty. Many personal but doing nothing. I couldn't believe it. Even the chairs were sticky.

We arrived in the lateevening. We just had 1 night and there for it is more than ok. The location is good near a lot of restaurants. Please be aware there is a lot of construction work. The room is what you are used from ibis compact. We booked one night for eur 35

Welcoming and friendly staff. Was as per my expectation. Clean and average hotel. Breakfast was simple eggs yoghurt nuts fruits juices etc but was good. We spent a lot of our time eating outside the hotel but the one dinner I had here was tagine lamb with vegetables and it was excellent. For the amount we paid ie b&b it was well worth the amount.

column3: Very comfy at a very nice price
column4: I had a very good experience. I don't speak Arabic and I am not fluent in French but the staff can speak Spanish & English. The are very kind and are always looking for you in case you need anything. The bedroom was very neat.

column3: Home away from home in Tanger
column4: Nice modern hotel situated in a modern central area of Tangier and within walking distance to a big shopping centre. Room was clean, confortable and with a big flat screen tv. The toilet was clean modern and functional. The only area to improve is the quality of the breakfast - it is not worth the money you pay for it...

I stayed here for a week and would do it again. It is a basic hotel, clean, good location, close to the train station and mall, one block to the Boulevard with plenty of restaurants and fast foos stores and 2 blocks to the beautiful beach. The Rooms are sufficient, not the biggest around, but you basically only stay here to sleep, so it is fine. A fridge was missing, maybe that is something management should be considering adding. A highlight here is for sure breakfast that is complimentary and avail until 10.30am. It was really good, especially the baguette, fresh and tasty! After 10.30am, there is still a snack buffet avail until noon. A special thanks to the barstaff that were incredible, friendly and funny. I loved to end my evening with the beautiful staff here. Great…

column3: Great location but need a good spring cleaning!
column4: Perfect location...less than 5 minutes to the train station, shopping mall and a quick taxi trip to the bus station for Chefchaouen. Even walkable to the Medina (took us about 30 minutes). Staff were very helpful but think management needs to hire more housekeepers. The floors in our room were awful and room needing a good wipe down...if the housekeeping issue were address, we would rate it higher.

column3: Good for an IBIS ranch but rooms are noisy
column4: The location is amazing, you are very close to the movie theatre, shopping mall, even the beach is not very far. It's better than the usual IBIS, but rooms were really noisy, we asked to change the room as we couldn't sleep because of the BD noise but even in the new one it was not any better. Breakfast is good as well

Rooms are very simple need more improved food quiet nice but staff are very very friendly and helpful mr Ahmed night shift reception, thank you very much for all ur assists and thanks to mr Reda duty manager for all the things good job to front office team continue they are giving a good image about the Accor company ,well done .👌👌

We wanted to be close to the train station as we had an early train to catch next morning. It was friendly and clean. It was close to the sea. It has a bar as well. The breakfast is a bit expensive though. Please note that the train station is behind the new one they are building.

Nice hotel in Tangier Morocco as transit before take a ferry to Algecias, basic and as usual a minimalise decoration, good breakfast too and the hotel provide parking space to the guest, strategic location near to Tangier town

Some staff were good, others very offhand. Restaurant food and wine good. Room was tiny - twin share with literally 6 inches between the beds.Very hard to move around the room and no space for 2 suitcases (1 per person). 1 small towel each, 1 tiny cake of soap,but two small shampoo sachets.Nothing else. Bathroom floor was slippery, mouldy and dirty. . Room cards regularly stopped working.

We loved our stay at this Ibis hotel and would definitely stay here again if we ever return to Tangier. It's a five minute walk from the beach and the restaurants there. Hotel restaurant had surprisingly good food, which was nice because we got in late our first night and didn't want to go out to dinner. The staff was very friendly and helpful in answering our questions. Wi-fi was slow but otherwise I have no complaints.

Everything was OK. The location near the railway station is a good advantage. The staff is professional and welcome well the guests. the wifi network is good. the bed is also relax. Equipements of bathroom should be improved : towels, hand soap and two glasses instead of one

Good level of quality, and value for money. Improving location with shopping centre and restaurants close by. Recommend for business travellers to the city. Staff are friendly and welcoming, always ready to help.

The Hotel is ok in terms of equipment. However the staff is incredibly incompetent and not as we expect from this hotel which is part of the Accor group. When my friend got injured in the hotel we asked for bandage and were surprised to be asked to wait for 30mn for the "manager " to come, while my friend were bleeding. When we complained we were literally insulted by the receptionist (Abdelkarim)!!!!!! I have been to this hotel before but unfortunately it went all the way down.

It is hard enough to find a hotel that combines service and cleanliness ... Ibis city center takes up this challenge in Morocco. Staff helpful and available... Thanks to them... It will be difficult to find the same level of service and cleanliness in Morocco at this price...

in general it was unusual experience but still consider it not bad as i came very late night about 2 -3 am and still get a room ( nice room) to sleep the best thing is the room service breakfast was yummy and really more than enough pricing is a bit expensive compared to local other hotels but cheap compared to overseas standard.

In the city centre from the port about 10 mins in a taxi. This should cost you 50 dirum including tip. When you get off the boat you will be approached by several guides. We used a guide called Achmed they don't talk about money you just tip them what you think. We found him invaluable and he keeps all the street traders off of you as well and he takes you to what you want to see. Back to the Ibis. Standard rooms as over in the uk. Book on line far better deal. Clean. Good restaurant if you want to eat in. Swimming pool 🏊 very nice when hot. Staff attentive.

column3: The reception is rude especially Ms. Imane
column4: In check out the receptionist didnt give the receipt of first night credit card. When I requested she started speaking in French. We were speaking in English 1 second before. Ms Imane speaks english very good. And I tell her that I do not know french. Then she Said in English "you should learn". And then she started speaking in French. I asked that I want to talk her manager and she Said he comes at work after 10 am. Am I suprised " No of course". Ibis Tanger style. ☹️. Go far always from this hotel.

The location was great. Near to the city centre area and walking distance to the malls. The service was good, the staff waa nice. Breakfast was average good. Just one thing missing, a cattle to drink hot water like in asia that always have in every hotels room. But we still enjoyed our stay.

The location is the greatest thing. The House Keeping service need to be improved, fnd the room was not really clean, it is like they did not clean the floor for two days in a row. These two days the staff open the door to clean our room, i mean, come on if you have no idea whether the guest inside or not, at least knock first to check. I hang the towel so that the hotel does not have to change the towel as it is written there to save the trees but stiil they change the towel with the new one, everyday. I am ok with the breakfast. Worth the price. They have swimming pool as well. Walking distance, just a few minutes away from the mall and very close to the beautiful beach. Oh one more the English for the staffs and more SMILE needs to be improved as well. You guys are in…

This hotel is ideally located for those who need to travel by train (5 mn walk). It is also just as close to the Tanger City Mall that has a supermarket as well as shops and restaurants for all tastes. You can also find buses and taxis nearby. I asked for a calm room and I was disturbed by intense noise in the evening coming from cars in the boulevard, it lasts for hours (not the hotel's fault but I wish I was warned). The room was approximately clean but small. Cleaning ladies are easily distracted by each other, and the result is: dirty elements are forgotten in the room, and used hygiene items are not even replaced. The receptionist also lacked professionalism and couldn't find my filled online check-in form. However, the staff is generally very nice and welcoming. Breakfast…

We chose this hotel because we were coming in by ferry from Tarifa, Spain and wanted a convenient transit hotel near the train station for our train to Fes the next morning. Pleasant staff who spoke English, Spanish & French. Rooms were basic, nothing fancy. This hotel's location is key, being only a 5-10min walk away from the station. And only a 5min walk to the nearest shopping mall (to buy SIM cards, supermarkets, etc) and a 15min walk to the beachside promenade where you can see camels on the beaches and restaurants to dine at. Just be careful around the shopping mall area. We were accosted by a group of Moroccan children asking us for money. They were relentless and followed us around for a good 10 minutes. Luckily a group of local ladies stopped to help us (I guess…

I stayed for 1 night. Everything was clean comfortable and excellent working order. All exactly what I was expecting for an Ibis hotel. I had a very good night sleep and in the morning I enjoyed the breakfast buffet. I enjoyed it so much that I decided to make it a 1.5 hour breakfast break with a few extra espresso's in a nice, cool comfortable restaurant. Just what I needed on a Sunday morning after a hectic week.

column3: a convenient place for short stays
column4: I stayed 2 night in this hotel which is withing a walk to the train station and Tangier mall. The room is basic but has a good bed and wifi signal. The hotel has a nice fairly small swimming pool and breakfast buffet with variety of choices.

We stayed here one night en route to going home. The bathroom was mouldy and had existing hair on the shower wall, disgusting. Breakfast and service were dire. Felt like I was at school by being handed a tray to collect my things. Everything seemed to take forever.

column3: Would Paul Dubrule and Gerard Pélisson be happy?
column4: Stayed here in May. The hotel is very central and only 5 minutes drive to the bus station. The room is fairly basic and the bed a little hard. The Dinner was okay, very basic had Kebabs with Rice and Vegetables. Asked some questions during dinner of the restaurant personnel and never had anyone come back with a response. Check-in and Check-out was very slow. There were staff behind the reception area but never more than one ever attended to guests. Breakfast was okay, nothing special, did not see any ice protecting milk, yoghurt and similar items from over heating. A package was left at reception for me with bus and hotel tickets inside but in spite of three separate attempts, the envelope was never found. Although on one attempt they checked me out of my room in spite of check…

The Ibis provided just what we wanted - a convenient stop-over between arriving off the ferry from Tarifa and heading south the next morning. The staff were helpful and the facilities good. We didn't sample the breakfast as past experience has shown that it tends to be bland and relatively overpriced, and there are better alternatives easily available. But we will almost certainly be booking an Ibis again in Morocco at some point!

Very poor breakfast. Dirty restaurant. Slippery shower floor. Good location close to the railway station and the corniche.I will never stay in this hotel.Needs lots of work to improve. That is all. Thanks

Stayed here for one night only and cancelled our second stay due to overall under par Ibis standard. Our room was very small and the air-condition did not work which made sleeping very difficult. Bathroom and shower cubicle were poorly maintained. Had dinner & breakfast in the hotel and this was very poor, too. Overall very disappointed with this hotel. Location is good, near the train station and a big mall.

The hotel is near to all the large hotels within walking distance of the train station. Quite a long walk from the town but you can walk along the front. The pool is pointless, there are no sun beds to sit on. Every time we came back at night we couldn't get in the room and had to go to reception to get them to activate the card.

its the third time i have visited this hotel and its always amazine to be theire, breakfast was excelent rich and varried, the staff was very very helpful especially the gay names Anas , he so kind and awsome.the location was clean and great.

column3: The room is OK, the staff need to improve their hospitality
column4: As a regular Accor guest, I say that the room is OK ... the Ibis standard. Quite nice. The location is close to the shopping mall and train station. The staff need to improve their hospitality though. The service is quite bad for an Accor standard.

Stayed here for a business trip. The hotel location is very good, you are next to the city center and a new mall. Breakfast is good quality, but the view, behind the hotel is not so great. There is a building site next to it.

It was a simple, clean, efficient hotel just a walking distance to train station. Receptionist quickly serve me both check in and out, room was nice and quite, ammenities and toilettries also well arranged. Will surely visit the hotel if any chance to Tangier someday.

column3: Great hotel close to the train station
column4: All staff were wonderful and spoke English (which was good because my French is pretty bad). The room was very pleasant: clean, modern, and cool. We faced the main intersection in the front of the hotel but close the window and it was perfectly quiet

I stayed at the hotel with a team conducting an assessment and we were sadly disappointed. The sheets in my room were thin, old and torn and the Internet did not work. Breakfast was sparse. One of my colleagues had to change rooms because there was hair on his pillow and he slept with a towel over his pillow in the new room. There was only one old bath towels and no hand or face towel and not even a glass in the bathroom. The staff was not helpful when I asked about the Internet so I could not complete my work on time. I won't stay there again. Either will the other members of our team.

Ok let me start with the positives. Location is great. You are close to everything. It is pretty clean. AC is good. Negatives: Key card not working. We had to reset it 4 times in one day because it stopped working. Breakfast wasn't great. There is no iron. If you want to iron your clothes you need to pay. They don't give you enough towels. The bed is high and difficult to get onto if you have any disability or pregnant. Bad lighting in the rooms (makeup issues). I think there are better hotels out there.

column3: Great hotel- as long as there's no fire. DANGER!
column4: I came here with my high school debate team, and their service and food were excellent, everything was clean and met our needs. Why give them such a low rating? It was my student who showed up downstairs, unsure what to do, because the fire alarm was going off, AND THE HOTEL STAFF WERE COMPLETELY UNAWARE THAT THE FIRE ALARM WAS GOING OFF. So, sure, stay here. Play roulette with your life. Hope there's not an actual fire while you're there.

We ended up at this Ibis after the taxi took us to the wrong place. We had reservations at the location near the airport and after driving for a while and me asking him if it's the Tanger Free Zone Ibis we were going and him saying yes in his best English, we ended up here. 😑 We canceled our reservation at the other location and booked here. I was sort of happy we did, because the location of this Ibis is great. It's nearer to the city center and within walking distance of the mall. We went to the mall a couple of times during our weekend stay. Anyway, the staff is great and wifi works well as any other Ibis. My only complaint is that the bathroom didn't appear as clean as it could be. Or it wasn't as clean like other Ibis's I'd been. There were soap sud marks on the tile in…

column3: one towel per person is not my idea of a good hotel
column4: The service was fine but I was told that management limits the number of towels to one per person (2 per room where there 2 people). I am not used to using the same towel for my hands, face and other parts of my body. There is something called hygiene. Did Accorhotels ever hear of it????

We are backpacker travellers coming from Hong Kong. Firstly, I'd really thanks for all the kindly served especially the hotel manager. He can speak English to us fluently where we couldn't found it in the rest of the city. Location is just spot on. It's right next to the bus and railway stations. The hotel isolates from the old city area which means you can have an peaceful night. No beggars in front of your hotel entrance or surrounding area. Since the entrance of the hotel is protected by G4S . In addition, the area is protected by military forces and you could hardly found any dangerous from this area where it's a huge difference compare to the old city area. And I can certainly say that this hotel's standard is definitely much higher than any local hotels.

when we checked in the room, there was a man already sleeping in the bed! Yes, the room was already occupied. Upon going back to the reception, they guy over there did not bother to apologize, and said: "it happens", and blamed a colleague....

We arrived on the 18th of February in the evening and made a walk-in booking. The Front Desk manager was amazing and very patient with us, he was quick to give us the room available and provided us all the details and prices around. Very polite and hospitable staff indeed. Perfect English :-) Room was small but clean and more than enough to have a good night's sleep.

column3: Good place for a quick rest
column4: We arrived at Tangier from Chefchaoen and decided to stay at Ibis, as it was located at the centre of the city. The room was quite cramped as expected and inside the room was quite hard to get the wifi connected. But at the lobby no problems whatsoever with the wifi. The hotel was nice and quiet so we are able to get some rest before continuing our journey. Not bad for a quick rest at this olace and the staffs were also very friendly.

column3: What you see is what you get
column4: Standard room with all the basics : tv, phone, wifi, lots of hot water. had a quiet night, slept with window open. staff very friendly. no room service but you can order downstairs and take it up to your room, then leave the tray out for pickup. very good value for money and close to the beach and the train station, easy to park the car.

column3: Please Avoid pay extra and choose Ramada
column4: Well this is the second time I was staying in IBIS CityCenter, and it was terrible... I stayed at the hotel just over a week. The male staff were rude specially a security guard in particular...., they always oggle at the women.... As if they have never seen one... There is no kettle in the rooms to make tea, there are exposed power points in the bathroom... However the cleaning ladies are true gems... Everything else is rubbish but they are really sweet. When checking in the guy at the desk was surprised that I was staying so long.... Maybe he knew how poor the service was.....

column3: Bug infested rooms - best to avoid!
column4: Stayed for a couple of nights. Was unable to sleep and kept awake due to bug bites. Called reception and they said there was nothing they could do. Came down finally at 3am and after having to shout at reception staff they found another room for me to complete the night. Really poor customer service - they simply couldn't care less. No compensation or reduction in rate. Stayed the rest of my stay closer to the old city.

column3: Rooms a bit knackered expensive drinks parking not free
column4: For the same price you can stay at a much newer hotel just across the road. Air con not working. No answer when calling reception. No safe no clean towels room smelt musky no iron no nothing except a bed and tv, paid 1300dirhams for a drink that should only cost 350. only stayed for one day before I checked out and checked into encore ramada which was cheaper and so much better

column3: Great nights sleep and fantastic value for money.
column4: We found all the staff (without exception) to be courteous, friendly, professional and approachable at all times. Breakfast was both plentiful and enjoyable. We spent 8 marvelous days in Tangier at this hotel, we slept exceptionally well each night. I would definitely not hesitate to return to this hotel again in the future. If I had to find any fault regarding this hotel, it would be regarding location alone, it is located a short petit taxi ride (approx 15 drms) to a greater selection of restaurants.

This was a nice hotel in Tangier. We stayed only one night, it was close to the beach and had a nice pool and area. The bar was good and the staff was great while we were there. I would use any of the IBIS Hotels....always a good pick and price.

Very dirty room not cleaned mold in the shower, dead bugs in the bed, unwashed pillows, yellowish stains on the sheets, bed sheets torn, stained, repayment of two weeks in advance spayées refused - hotel absolutely to be avoided - we are three people have suffered this history - nevermore! - I made a lot of pictures about all !

My friend booked this hotel for a twin room in advance for our trip to Tangier, Morocco. When we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that there are no more twin rooms available. What the hotel staff suggested is to put an extra mattress on the floor for the other person to sleep on. This did not go down well. It was not nice to be treated like one of you is a slave and the other is the master. The thing is, a guest does not expect this kind of insensitivity especially after figuring out in a vehicular accident that delayed the trip by five hours, both with headaches and has no strength to argue our rights at that point. The hotel's own policy is to ensure guests satisfaction and if not achieved, they will go out of their way to achieve customr satisfaction. But nothing…

tanks to all members my stay was perfect ; i was there with my friends the stay was perfect the hotel team was OK with us the reception the restaurant we get all what we need at any time / also i recommend this hotel for any one .

눉I stayed here because I thought I would be able to easily walk to the train station the next morning. WRONG. No footpaths, no light controlled crossings and just far too dangerous to consider. Do far better to stay near the old Medina. The wifi was truly terrible. Hours on end it did not work and when it did very slow. The bathroom was not clean and the basin plug could not be easily removed as the control was bent and useless. The towels were small, thin and grey. The food in the restaurant was appalling. I ordered an entrecote cooked medium rare, turned up done like boot leather so back it went. No easy choices for food close by. The breakfast was poor value and only Earl Grey tea bags available. The room was clean and fairly quiet

column3: It is what you pay for.
column4: Pretty average hotel. Rooms are ok, for the price. 3/5 for cleanliness and size. The place seemed understaffed so service was not the best. We picked this as we were in Tangier only for a night and taking a ferry to Tariffa the next day. Located centrally so quite close to the port.

column3: A good place in an amazing city
column4: I'm a Moroccan and I live in a city near Tanger so I didn't expect anything special in my period of staying in Tanger. but I was wrong because staying at that Hotel is definitely a good thing to do. The hotel has a great service in the Bar and the staff is kind of nice too. The breakfast is served early but it's really amazing. And even the look from outside is amazing. So I really recommend this hotel.

we arrived at tanger very late at night ibis was the best choice clean quiet and nearby to many good and nice restaurants the price was a little high but as advice to have a discount you have to book by internet better

column3: Nice hotel in a nice city
column4: The hotel is good, typical new Ibis. It has pleasant and big reception area, wi-fi, clean rooms. The breakfast was good, the personnel were nice and helpful. The hotel is situated close to the railway station (you can walk there), it was convenient for us, as we arrived in Tangier from Rabat by train. The hotel is also not far from the bus station (we took a taxi there, as we were going to Chefchaouen by bus). To the beach you can walk for about 10 min; if you're going to the old city, it takes 25-30 minutes on foot. We had a very nice impression of the city and the hotel. We stayed there for 1 night in January.

Great Hotel, great staff, Great Breakfast, great Position, can walk to the Old Port in about an hour, that's where the good value restaurants are right by the Old Dock Station that was,,,Also a 5 minute walk takes you to the Station, which is closed at the moment to get it ready for the High Speed Train,,,but at the roundabout catch No.20 bus for the 2nd. Tangier station, cost 3.50 DH and not 50 DH that the taxi's charge.Over the other side off the roundabout the No.20 goes to the New Port,,Mediterrane, for the ferries to Spain....

If you have stayed at a Ibis Hotel, it looks very similar. The room are clean and tidy but they need thicker wall. You can heard the rooms next door and what ever is going in the hall. If you are a light sleeper ask to be in the most quiet room possible. Breakfast is a buffet, aka English breakfast with French pastries. The food is fresh and nice, the service is great. Wifi is available using the code they give you but those with Blackberry service might encounter issue. my Blackberry did not recognised the login and had no access to the WIFI.

Nice room nice staff hospitality was good and had a good night sleep here. Only thing which stopped me from giving it a 5 was the amount of women who were clearly not staying at the hotel were entering and it seemed like they were escorts. Did not ruin or affect me though just seems the security needs to pay a bit more attention Good hotel nevertheless rooms were clean and spot on.

I really dont know what to start with. Very noisy room 405 facing west even in the fourth floor. The WiFi code was expired. We had to call again to get another code. I tried to take a shower and guess what, only three towels, medium size and so not soft. The big discovery was hair everywhere on the shower walls. I dont think they bother themselves to clean the shower walls. Water is not hot. It is only warm. At the bed headboard there is multiple oily spots. The white bed comforter has a black shoe print. Overall, a hotel not to be recommended at all.

The hotel is overall nice and fairly new, with small European style rooms and cheaply built. The staff though are all crooks and scam artists. The Ibis is very close to the train station which is really convenient, however there are much better hotels that are only a cheap grand taxi away. When asking about transport to Tangier Med the front desk staff (we asked three separate ones) said the only way possible to get there was by a grand taxi 400 MAD and since we were six we would need to grande taxis so 800MAD, When we asked about the train (which is why we stayed at this hotel) they said there was nor, and when we questioned it they stated that they were sure that there is no train or bus and a grand taxi was the only way. So after spending three weeks in Morocco I learned…

Stayed one night. Checkin was fairly fast. The lobby was nice. The room not so nice. There were streaks of some type of liquid on the wall, it was cold in the room due to Acorr's commitment to reduce energy at the expense of its guests. Free wifi and breakfast. Had dinner, the waiter was the only redeeming person for not giving a lower star rating, he was fantastic, personable and a great smile.

column3: Good choice to escape the city bustle
column4: This is your standard IBIS hotel which can be a relief after too many Riads. This hotel is near to the train station and about 40 minutes walk from the town centre (or 8 Dihrams in a taxi). There is a strip of restaurants on the beach nearby so lots of food choices. Avoid the expensive breakfast and go out for better choice and cheaper prices. Overall a good choice if you want a reasonable priced escape from the hustle and bustle.

Standard ibis experience. Clean, efficient, wifi ok, staff all right, breakfast ok. Came by ship and left by train, location was perfect and continued towards the south of Morocco well rested. Restaurant had pasta and similar mediterranean dishes, was ok. Moroccan wine available, price/quality of which seems to be good everywhere, ibis city center too. Would stay again for a layover, not necessarily for a longer stay as there are affordable seaview hotels on Mohamed V.

Although I finally did not stay at the hotel, the staff was really helpful. They let us stay at the lobby, charge phones and connect to wifi network. Also share some tips about the city. Thank you for your hospitality!

Good stay in the Ibis Tanger City Centre. short walk from downtown. The room was clean, the beds comfortable and the climatisation works good. The breakfast also was correct. Breakfast: only one machine to make coffe sometimes was to less and the guests had to queue. Internet was Ok in all hotel

I have stayed in many a hotel and a lot of budget ones as well. After all we all like to save money. It's a while since I have been to Morocco and I am always a little dubious when in developing countries. I must admit though the standards of good and drink were top quality. Shame about the building works in the city but the hotel was an oasis. If you are in the city try this hotel all the staff happy to help so are the cab drivers. However I don't think they have MOT's out there.

large hotel placed on a major junction about 200 metres from the main railway station . Room looked over the main road and has an enourmous building project going up on the right hand side looking up the main road consisting of two Hilton hotels one 4 star and the other 5 star and a shopping mall and cinema complex which should have been completed by October 2014 but is clearly several months behind schedule . Hotel itself is ok in that it is a typical Ibis built facility with clean bedding and whilst the towels were clean they were threadbare and thats your lot no hand towels just a bath towel . We dined in the hotel and found the food tasty though they seemed to scrimp a bit on the servings . The hotel is only about 150 yards from the front nd the sandy beach and has a…

column3: ok and good price !! best deal in town thinks me
column4: just the right price and the right comfort ! been to loads of hotels in tangier and this is the best beyond doubt, by malabata and good restuarants and the rooms are clean as the sheets, just right for the price of £25 !!

A good, reasonably smart hotel. Excellent rooms for the price and good breakfasts for small additional cost. Some of the staff members were very friendly and helpful, others were pretty miserable. You can change currency at the hotel, but they don't publish exchange rates or give receipts. Perhaps this is normal in Tangier?

good location, near train station and beach internet for free and works fantastic (all over hotel) swimmingpool very small and therefor crowded helpful reception and general good atmosphere will come again

Very good stay in the Ibis Tanger City Centre. Just a short walk from the station and the generous hotel welcomes you. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable and the climatisation works good. The breakfast also was good, just only one machine to making coffe sometimes was to less and the guests had to queue for longer times.

it was our first time in Morocco and our expectations were low.Ibis provided cheap and decent enough accommodation. Food at the restaurant below was better than the stuff we ate at other local places, and the waiter was honest and friendly, recommend it. Rooms can be cleaner, but we the hotel was the cleanest place we have been to while we were there we think. Reception staff was helpful and courteous, they worked hard and long hours by the look of things.

A bit off the city center, the hotel is relatively clean and nice, although very basic. Near the train station, where you'll either be taking a taxi downtown or a train to some other part or Morocco. Tanger old town is worth a visit, the rest of it not so much.

Nothing special. In a good way. It works, sort of clean. Service is ok. Hot water in a shower. So, everything you need about hotel. Same time it is boring. Location is bad, middle of construction site and quite far from city. And there is no interesting restaurant nearby. Would I go again? Probably no.

Very nice stay in this hotel near the center of Tanger. Clean rooms,good service and gentle people to serve you .The breakfast is in buffet ,with every day fresh bread,croissant and some morocan specialities best quality -price .

Standard hotel located in the new area of the city, a walk from the beach and 10 Dhs by cab from the city centre. It's new and clean, nothing special. Wifi usually doesn't work. We were awaken but the fire alarm on the first night, around 4am, wich was ridiculously loud, so quite stressful, apparently someone was smoking inside one of the rooms, so he got everyone up... Not the hotel fault's, but they just smiled when we asked about the incident, didn't even apologize.

After arriving at Tangier med by ferry from Gibraltar (rus Fridays) and negotiating a price with a taxi driver, their is a bus for 2 euro but it's an hour wait and it drops you at the bus station!, anyway check in, room, bed, shower and staff speaking English was exceptional, nothing was a problem even when we returned from having a meal they provided us with glasses an a bucket of ice for our night cap! We were only going to stay 1 night has we were heading to Marrakech, but ended up staying 3, must say Tangier is a great place to visit and explore, and with the staff and the service they provide at the ibis hotel itself is worth visit. Yes their is building works an some pavements are not finished but look beyond that and I'm sure you want find a lot better for value for…

Nice clean Ibis, 5 minuite walk from the Gare de Tanger tho you have to walk on the road side to get to it, which can be a bit dangerous. Its about a 10 min walk from la playa where you will find plenty of cafes restaurants and night life. The location is slightly isolated, there is a swimming pool for you to relax. The room views aren't fantastic but it fine for the price and short stop over. Outside there are grand taxis to take you around, by the station you shall find more. Breakfast is good buffet style, tea coffee, cereal cold milk, fruit etc. Overall a nice experience and I would recommend this hotel for short stays.

column3: Correct hotel good breakfast (very close to trainstation)
column4: Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Very correct rooms, as well as the service The breakfast was good as well. The best thing about the hotel is that you are at walking distance from the trainstation.( 3 minutes) So if you have to take a train next morning i really recommend this hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for a few nights earlier this month. The hotel is perfectly located for access to beach and is close an excellent cafe/restaurant right by the sea. Multiple ATMs and fastfood places are similarly close. The overall standard of the hotel exceeded what I expected given the low price. Staff were warm, friendly, and helpful, and while the room I stayed was basic, it was a good size and was clean and comfortable. Cleaning staff were non-intrusive and cleaned to a high standard daily. Breakfast was of a good standard. Internet access (Wifi) was consistently good, though there were a few issues when I needed to make an international phone call, as the system was down for quite some time. That said, I spoke with the staff and manager on evening of Tuesday 18th…

Nice clean Ibis Hotel, friendly staff, nice rooms, big beds, flat screen tv various language channels. Very close to the station, grand taxis outside hotel to take you to the airport. No shops nearby, lots of building work,.

The Good Standard Ibis. Clean, comfortable rooms. Near the train station. Walking distance to the old town and near the water. The Bad Restaurant and breakfast both over priced. While there were many cafés and restaurants within a few blocks walk the immediate vicinity of the hotel was less than inviting.

Very interesting hotel for 28€/night price. Clear, contamporain and chip. The only negative point is kind of reception :) Any way, I passed an amazing holyday in tangier... want to return asap I recommend everybody to go there

The hotel is closed to train station, even you can see it from the station. It is very convenient if ypu plan traveling by train. It's closed to corniched and the beach, it is nly 300 meters something (in walking distance). It's not difficult to find taxi to bring everywhere I want. Breakfast is buffet and the food was OK. The staffs are friendly and informative. The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. But, the towels are looked old. I think management is supposed to think for changing the. It's perfect for one night stay.

The breakfast was good and the service was acceptable. The room was relatively clean, but the hotel needs new bath towels. They are so think it takes two after a shower to become dry. For those of us who speak neither French or Arabic, the front desk staff need to be better at English. They also can be more helpful with directions and local transportation, such as how to use the mini-taxis.

column3: It would be nice if they could fix 2 or 3 things
column4: It is located next to the train station and it is easy to find a cab to drive you anywhere you want, but if you really like to walk, it won't be difficult for you to get to the Medina by yourself.The check-in went smoothly, the room was ok as well as the bathroom ( which wasn't cleaned thoroughly as i found a lot of short hair on the floor, which is gross even if it were yours), i noticed also a lot of dust in the room, around the cupboard. Also, if you look closely at the parquet floor, you will see that it is a bit dirty (the wood comes in a dark color so it's convenient not to clean it!!!). As mentioned in other reviews, the towels were hideous and looked more like floorcloth. It's a shame as the hotel has several upsides: a big and confortable bed, a large choice of tv…

Good infrastructure and excellent location. A well maintained hotel that combines good customer service and the usual Ibis accomodation facilities that you will find elsewhere. Lobby and breakfast area were very nice. Room was what we expected; clean, with a nice view from Tangier city and fitted with a TV and air-conditioning. Bed was fantastic. Can only mention that towels need urgent replacement, as it seemed rather too old. Hotel is conveniently located close to Gare Tangier, where trains are fast and cheap. There are also a couple of good restaurants nearby.

Overall a fantastic hotel with great interior. Modern building as well. There was a good breakfast but was no hot options only cold muffins, quassants ect. The rooms were good, but small and wouldn't recommend for a family. I stayed there with one other person and was still a bit squashed mind you we pulled the beds apart to make two singles, but still little room. Not sure how other rooms vary. 7th floor view fantastic and even though busy traffic outside, slept well. Good tv, English channels! Large pall round the back, but all the lifeguards VERY strict!!!! Only problem was that in 3 nights we got through five electric key-cards and that was complicated. None of the other rooms had this problem! Overall you get what you pay for but good sleep. No bath, only shower but…

Good value for what you pay. Free parking out the front was no problem leaving our car there for the night. Rooms were ok could do with a spring clean and a spruce up- we did have a large area that the paint was scraped off the wall and it wouldn't take much to paint it over. Lovely high and comfortable queen bed. Blinds were ok but the condition was a bit shabby. Good shower that is fully enclosed so the water dosent wet the bathroom but again the bathroom needs a through clean. The towels were the worst towels I have ever encountered! They were grey, threadbare, shabby and basically disgusting. I thought they were cleaning rags they were that bad. I was surprised by the chain allowing these to be used. The hallway and foyer needing vacuuming and mopping and attention is…

Basically an OK hotel for the money you are paying for it. Stayed in many Ibis hotels and this was on a par with them with the following exceptions. No towels in the room and when I requested them got them about an hour later. They were threadbare and thin and did not look too well washed. In short they were like the old towels I have for washing my dog. No one bothered to make up the room the second day. Do not know why. front desk staff were pleasant but seriously overworked with queues any time I past the front desk.

column3: You get waht you pay! Good stay, great bed!
column4: When one stays at an ibis one must adjust expectations to an ibis, right? Overall good stay, the room could have been cleaner but would go back again. Positives: Price (that's why I stayed there and not in more expensive place!), location (quiet area yet close to beach area and longish walk to Medina and Kasba but taxis are cheap and I like walking. It is true, there are a lot of construction sites around them but never heard noise or felt unsafe, maybe a lot of dust but you can keep the windows closed). Bed was great and staff overall very friendly and helpful. Negatives: The room was not very clean, floor could have done with an extra mopping and some hairs in the bathroom but again nothing terrible, the loo, basin and shower were very clean. WIFI: Not functioning all…

column3: Terrible experience from the staffs' side!!!
column4: Starting on a good note, average hotel with good location. To add, few of the staffs indeed were polite and helpful. But what ruined my stay was the other few staffs who totally do not know what service basically means. My friends who are African American were turned back saying there is no room available. And less then 10 mins we got a room without any trouble. The display sign says one price and what they charged us was way too much than what we were told in the phone. I asked to talk to the manager who "was not there". I asked if they have room service and the guy after realising its my first time in Morocco was like, well there is no room service but m willing to give you one. One of my friends was even invited to go to the beach. Its sad that you are with your friend…

This is an average Ibis hotel, but with a very good location. The sea front and main walking area with lots of restaurants and the beach is only a 5 minute walk away. The train station is also very close, though we didn't use the station while there. We had a car and there was lots of free, secure parking. The rooms and bathrooms were small and everything had a "budget" feel to it. The breakfast was average. The service from the hotel staff was atrocious. We had booked a bed and breakfast rate for our family of 4 but the staff argued with us that we did not have breakfast included in our rate. We had to show them our email confirmation before they believed us. We also asked for 2 connecting rooms because we have 2 kids. The staff assured us we could get that, but then changed…

- Good Hotel and Excellent Location - Very near from train statios - like 200 meters. - Near of the beach of Tangier - like 500 meters. - Close to the Hotel have many restaurants and bars. - Best option when you need to travel by train.

column3: Great hotel overall, but rooms are very small, located next to station and 5min walk to sea front
column4: Overall good hotel, especially if you get it for anything cheaper than EUR 45.00. It will not be up to the European standard of IBIS chain, but they are trying their best. + value for money located next to train station friendly English speaking staff - Very tiny room

in this Ibis hotel I found the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is clean, but the facilities in the Room is minimum I found there was no small fridge, so one can keep water or any refreshment over night in the room, without finding it hot in the morning I believe this should be giving a hard look at, specially in a hot country like morocco, and shower room doors are very hard to open. whatever happened to maintenance?

The rooms are not big, but nice and clean. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is situated right next to the train station. However I wouldn't say it's in the center, which the name suggests. There is a nice pool, but there weren't any deckchairs. The brekfast is good, especially the Moroccan pancakes.

column3: Lovely palce and good value for money
column4: An lovely place, next to the trainstation. Good value for money and a pititi taxi ride to bus station is about 6DH Beach, MacDonald and other good eating places. Ask for room at top floor due to noise on the road.

Clean, nice breakfast next to a lovely pool, near to train station, near to corniche and restaurants, nice receptionists, good although few tv channels, conceivable prices. Has no mini-cooler, and like some Moroccan hotels, it has no toilet-pipes to wash dirty (a vice for Muslims ) . Old Medina is app. 3.5 km far.

As a hotel, its a generic Ibis, smart, unspectactular. The pool is a welcome addition, and not usual for Tangier. The restaurant is fine, small but reasonable selection and decent quality. The problem is the location, its near the train station, but otherwise its not walkable to town, and is not a lot nearby including needing to cross a very busy road. But in a couple of years, when the building work in the area is completed then it would become a much better prospecf If you need the station, its a good bet, otherwise I'd be wary of the location

The Ibis city centre is convenient in that it is near the train station in Tangier. However, the environs of the hotel resemble a business park and it is a fair walk to the seafront and restaurants. The hotel is a relatively modern Ibis. The rooms are typical Ibis. They are small and comfortable. We were surprised that the man on reception was very rude to us. The room he gave us was badly prepared. There was a wet towel lying beside the bed and no clean towels in the bathroom. The bed appeared to have been made in a rush. When we asked for another room, the man on the desk told us that we could not have one as we had not complained within seven minutes of arriving in the room. Incredible! It was offensive as the implication was that we had used the room and were responsible for…

Everything ok, but poor breakfast compared with other IBIS. The room was ok and clean as other IBIS in the world. The hotel's surrounding are not the best because far from everything and people around not nice...but the location to go to the train station is pretty good

Tanger is great city to visit but if you want to have a good time AVOID AT ALL COST THIS HOTEL!!! 1. before making the reservation I called to ask if I could paid in cash at the hotel so the bill didn't go to my credit card, they said yes but they didn't keep the promise, I changed money to pay and in the last day before leaving I found myself with money that I couldn't use at home and with no time to change it back... 2. The first day they gave me a dirty room but withing minutes they changed my room and it was ok but in the second day they didn't clean the room properly, when I called to talk to someone they said that they would send someone to clean it but after one 1.30hs it was still dirty!!! when I tried to talk to the manager she never came, the receptionist said that…

Me and my friends stayed in Ibis Tanger City Center for a night in April 2013. The room is decent and clean, with free wifi available (but a weak one...just ok for instant message). The view from the room is great. If you're taking a train to Tangier, here is the place to stay - right next to the station! It takes around 10 mins grand taxi to the Medina which costs around 40 Dirhams. Good deal - you got more than what you paid for!

column3: Good value for money except breakfast.
column4: This Ibis is nicely located close to the sea and a short cab drive to the old center. Value for money is definitely ok: clean rooms, good service overall. The only downside was the breakfast: overboiled tea, the harira was not good (while it is a traditional soup and easy to make - be proud of your culinary heritage !), sloppy and cold scrambled eggs... At 59 dirham you would expect a much better experience. But we would come back to stay here - very convenient - and would have breakfast around the corner with a view on the sea and pay less...

column3: Ibis standard quality, best breakfast in Morocco
column4: The hotel follows Ibis' standards: comfortable bed, clean room and minimum service. The location is great, close to the train station and to the ocean front. The hotel is also a short walk from the medina and the bus station. The breakfast was the best part: it includes traditional dishes and typical breakfast. We were able to try some of the local breakfast delicacies, without giving up of our scrambled eggs! The only downside was proper information, although the lack of reliable information seems to be a generalized problem in Morocco. From every person we asked a question, we would get a different direction.

column3: Cheap and cheerful, rooms too stuffy
column4: Good location situated by main train station. 5 minute walk from mc donalds. Kadinsky and panorama are good cafes nearby within walking distance. There's a decent cafe thats does breakfast oppostite kadinsky called khay tanjer they do eggs, toast and fresh fruit juices for 20 dirhams. Clean hotel, rooms are hot and stuffy. Don't forget to buy bottled water. The Air con didn't work in both rooms we booked 501 and 518. Good free wifi. Poor view of construction sites, noisy works when windows are open. The reception desk is almost always busy, constantly have to wait for service. Good value at 25 pounds a night for twin room. Good for short stays only, wouldn't want to spend more than two nights here.

My advise is to not go there if you want to spend a good time as a couple. Rooms are tiny and you can find better places with the same price. The location is good, near the train station. I liked the colorful decoration. It's clean and calm, otherwise, nothing special. We stayed there for 1 night and we changed the hotel.

Clean rooms and a helpful staff. Conveniently located a short walk from the train station. The rooms were quiet - no train or traffic noise. Dinner at the restaurant was enjoyable with a good selection of Moroccan and other foods.

This hotel was bare bone. They were hesitant about providing us with an extra towel (there was only 2 in the room). The price is very cheap but you pay for what you get. It is located right by the train station and is about 15 min drive into town. The cost of a taxi into town is about 5 euro. The hallway smells like feet...and my friends blanket smelled sour. This place is okay for a short stop and if you plan on spending minimal amount of time there during the day.

I have stayed in a number of Ibis hotel across Morocco and found this hotel to be up to standard. The reception staff was extremely professional and helpful, and this was true for service across the board. The bed was firm and the rooms were clean. As this is an Ibis, the rooms are small and sparsely furnished but absolutely adequate for the traveller. I had multiple breakfasts and one dinner at the hotel and both meals were well attended with good food. I would not hesitate to stay here again - a good hotel.

Stayed there after staying in Riad gave me ample space for myself. Within walking distance from Tanger Ville train station in an area which will become the prime location in the future but now only construction sites here and there. Overall a good experience.

I stayed here last week 19 10 2012 and found the hotel very clean good size rooms with en suite shower tv wifi etc the food in the resuraunt is very good and keenly priced the rooms are cleaned every day. there is a business hub in reception and a small pool area to the front of the hotel. I would describe this hotel as a short stay due to the ammount of business people who use it.The location is just outside the city centre (about max 20DH in a taxi to anywhere in city limits) very close to the beach and train station. All in all this hotel is very well run the staff are polite and helpful and it has parking!!.

column3: A good hotel with European standards
column4: This hotel was very modern, clean and well equipped in everything including the swimming pool. The personnel of the hotel was very kind e helpful in everything. They mistaked giving us a smoking room and then they gave to us a non-smoking room in a minute. The quality of the food and the hygiene in the restaurant was very good and we always had dinner and breakfast there. Only one advice: if you are there in the period of Ramadan avoid to eat there dinner in the evening of Jawla (last evening of Ramadan with big celebration dinner). That evening they opened the restaurant 30 minutes later for the european customers because they had to serve the Jawla dinner to some moroccan customers from Tanger. When we sat there, we had to wait 30 minutes more to order and then 30 minutes…

good value, functional hotel. located next to train station. meals were ok, some of the people i was with had breakfast included but i walked around the corner for the same food at 1/3 price. rooms were clean - room with 2 beds had beds very close together, almost as 1. enough space to get luggage off the floor. shower had great pressure and room had awesome AC. the view is poor, as it overlooks much of the construction currently going on in tangier. pool is nice but closes early. we were disappointed one day after arriving home to a closed pool so we talked to the manager and he opened it right up for us! hotel is about 1/2 hour cab ride from beautiful beaches. about a ten minute walk to restaurants and night life. if you are taking a ferry from tangier MED, you must take a…

column3: Ideal for a One Night stop-over
column4: Just what you'd expect from an Ibis hotel ! Friendly and efficient staff in a clean, basic hotel. The room are small, facilities adequate but basic. The bed a bit small and rather firm !The buffet breakfast was satisfactory with a good range of dishes and included in the tariff. The bar and dining room are spacious and comfortable; the food of good quality and reasonably priced although the choices are somewhat limited.
Enjoyed staying overnight in this hotel - walking distance from railway station - nice helpful staff - would definitely use again.

This Hotel just opened a year ago. Overall it is a good hotel. Location is excellent.Being a muslim, living in muslim country i.e. Morocco there must be muslim showers in Bath rooms. I was so surprised to see that there was no lock in wash rooms. Overall it was nice. Imran

column3: Good value close to the station
column4: Standard Ibis hotel: functional but reasonably good value for money. Convenient location for us, right next to the railway station, as we were arriving from Fez by train at 10.00pm with our flight home the following morning, but not that great if you´re looking to spend a few days exploring Tangier. Clean, quiet room with very comfortable beds and a great power shower. Staff friendly but not particularly efficient. Mediocre breakfast.

We booked this hotel through the Accor website due to the rate approx US$70 for 2 including breakfast. Located close to the railway station and bus if catching it from Fez but you need to get a taxi to the old city and medina. Don't forget to negotiate the price before you get in. I would not recommend Tangier for more than 1 night and the medina is no where as good as what you find in Marrakesh or Fez. If you are travelling by ferry to Algerceris make sure it is from the port located in the old city centre otherwise you will have to pay US$20-$30 for a taxi to the other port. The hotel is very new and the rooms are clean and well appointed with a great shower and the bed guarantees a good night sleep. Staff were extremely helpful and always accommodating. As it is located out…
