Near the train station, does not mean this well located. Excellent hotel for one night. Clean and very good price if you book in advance. Far from the Medina, and approx 300 meters from the boardwalk. I absolutely recommend it if you spend just one night in Tanger and take next day the train.

New and with all the mod cons. We stayed here to try and save on our budget as we had stayed at riads with inflated prices. This was our last accomodation in Tanger. The area arround is all being developed. It is very close to Tanger railway station (Gare Tanger). It was too expensive on our budget to eat an evening meal, but this was no problem as we usually did our own thing in the souks/markets anyway. It is a bit of a distance from the medina, so we caught a cab, which was reasonable. Negotiate the price before getting in, as we had issues with both cabs here, .......their price being inflated once we arrived.

This IBIS has all the things you would expect in an IBIS hotel. The rooms are simple but perfectly adequate. The bed, which a little higher than normal, was the very comfortable. The room had excellent airconditioning and a roomy shower. The position of the hotel is perfect if you are planning to catch a train from Tangier, with the railway station only 200m away. You do have to cross a busy road but it is an easy walk otherwise unless you have huge amounts of luggage.

Overall the stay was good. For improvement, I would suggest putting more towels because two towels are not sufficient. In the bathroom there was not an electrical outlet in bathroom for shaver or any other electical appliances needed. Also there was one toilette paper and not another on reserve. I saw hair on the new sheets and even though they were clean, the hair gives an impression of dirty sheets. The biggest issue was internet, the wireless signal was very week and work intermitantly. The network hard wire connection did not work for the 3 days we stayed at the hotel.

This Ibis is not located in front of the beach, but it has a very competitive price. Also is new and modern. The buffet breakfast was also good. However, as it is common with the Ibis chain of hotels in Morocco, expect to have limited toiletries and cheap-thin quality towels (they only provide you with 2 towels daily per room because of the hotel policy). Thus, if you shower at night, expect to use the same damp towel next morning. In fact, if you ask for 2 more towels, they will only bring you 1 more, even if there are two guests in the room because is their policy. Also, it is important to note that this is a smoker friendly environment. Expect to see cigarrette trays in the lobbys and see guests smoking in the hotel reception. Although smoking in public places in Morocco is…

column3: Good value for the price paid
column4: This was a decent experience, way better that the 5 star Hotel "El Minzeh"! We stayed 3 nights and we added another night after checking out in "catastrophe" from El Minzeh! People are at least smiling while serving you! there was a problem with the Lift but otherwise everything else was exactly what I can call " an Ibis promise delivered"!

This is a brand new hotel about 100 yards from the train station. It has a small swimming pool and free internet access in the lobby. The rooms are new so they are clean and modern. You would have to take a taxi to the old section of the city and medina, but its a short ride for about 20dr. We walked back from the medina to the hotel along the coast road Ave Mohammed VI. When the sun is setting this is where all the locals hang out and walk up and down this coastal road. There are many restaurants, clubs and stores along this road. If you are traveling by train this hotel is in a perfect location. If you need a taxi you have to walk to the train station or get one off the street, taxis don't wait outside this hotel .

column3: Ibis innit do not go with your lover!
column4: A convenient middle rank business hotel which happens to be close to the project I have to visit. The staff are friendly and efficient the food is consistent and the rooms are all the same. There is no romance to it, there is no sea view there is no sol.

column3: perfect location, small rooms but very clean
column4: The title says it all: the location is great, about 300m walk to the boulevard, the rooms are small but very clean (as is the whole hotel). Staff is fluent jn French but struggling in English (but at least they try their best). At the rates they offer I will absolutely return to this hotel if I revisit Tangiers>

The hotel is just a little walk away from the center with nearby restaurants and shops. The beach is ten minutes away on foot. The staff is nice and helpful. There's plenty of space for parking any sort of vehicles. The rooms and bathrooms are large and clean. The Internet connection is excellent. It's perfect for a night or two.

column3: Clean, new hotel well located in Tangier
column4: The 1000th Accor hotel in the world, this hotel has been opened just a few months. It is very well located on a small property near the train station and very close to the beach. It's a good low budget, seven story hotel. Excellent value for the money with a very small pool - really just a kiddie pool - out back. Rooms are small but clean. Good showers. Two elevators service the seven floors. There is guarded parking in front of the hotel. You pay the guardian who is not affiliated with the hotel daily. There is no set fee. The restaurant, Wok Co., offers an Asian, Italian and Moroccan menu. It was ok. Stay in the hotel if you are looking for low budget and good quality for the money. A good place to use as a base to see Tangier, but not a hotel you go to if you plan to just…

column3: Very Nice Hotel: Simple but quite generous
column4: I have to give this hotel 5 stars , as Two nights with breakfast for 70 Pounds is outstanding value. It is a new hotel and as usual very near the Tanger train station. Staff are nice and friendly: The place is very clean. The rooms are not spacious though they are very accomadating. It has free wifi in the reception floor , including the restaurant area and forey / lounge.In the room there is a network cable to connect to your laptop, so free internet there too.Speed is not fast as Casa Voyageurs Hotel, but this is a much bigger hotel with ,ore rooms and internet traffic.I Would recommend this to anyone looking for a good quality 3 star hotel.
